newsitem.title: USA: Tele-Communications to lay off 2,500 employees.
newsitem.headline: Tele-Communications to lay off 2,500 employees.

text.p: Tele-Communications Inc., the nation's largest cable television operator, said Thursday it will cut 2,500 employees, or nearly 7 percent of its work force, as it seeks to lower costs and reduce debt.
The Englewood, Colo.-based company said it would review all expenses not directly related to serving customers.
The company said the layoffs, which will come from corporate headquarters and field offices, will amount to 2,500 managers and employees.
The layoffs were larger than had been anticipated by Wall Street analysts, who were looking for a 5 percent cut.
In a brief statement, Tele-Communications said it will also cut salaries or freeze the pay of senior executives unless it meets business objectives.
The announcement followed a meeting this week of Tele-Communications Chief Executive John Malone with a group of investors at the company's headquarters.
Tele-Communications faces daunting challenges, including stiff competition from direct broadcast satellite television services whose popularity is growing faster than experts had expected.
The company's stock, which has lingered near its 52-week low of $11.25, rose 62.5 cents to $13.75 on Nasdaq.
